Choices:  A: chicago B: street C: little italy D: food court E: capital cities<n><n>### Response:		<n>There are several places to receive a pizza. One pizza parlor is the food court. The second is the capital cities. The third would be Little Italy. The fourth pizzeria would be little Italy. The fifth would be Italy.<n><n>### Demo:<n>You need to add a new column to every person's name and use that column to identify them in a query.<n><n>#### Instructions: Add a new column with the name of each person and put an asterisk into an adjacent cell.<n><n>#### Solution:<n>There are several columns in a query. One column is the name of every person. The second column is their name again. The third column is the name of each person. The fourth column is their name.<n><n>### Problem:<n>You add a new column to each person's name and insert asterisks into adjacent cells.<n><n>#### Instruction:<n>You need to create a copy of the original sheet called "Customer Copy" without affecting any data.<n><n>#### Solution 1:<n>There are several sheets in a workbook. This type of work can be used in both speaking and writing.<n><n>### Challenge:<n>Summarize the paragraph we just completed, your sentences must be between 10 and 20 words.<n>Challenge 1: My name is Zaria and one thing I like to do is go to the bookstore and browse the titles. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:Though she made the cut years ago, its figurative scars would never what? Choices:  A: joining B: put together C: stitch D: heal E: paste<n><n>### Response:		A.The cut is part of her history. The best way to avoid scarring is to avoid inflicting them in the first place. You avoid inflicting a wound by cutting safely. If you are injured in an accident, the cuts will be stitched.<n><n>### Input is cut a wound, it will be stitched at a what? Choices: B: cut C: stitched D: pasted<n><n>### Response is cut a wound is inflicted by a stitch, that's why a wound is stitched. Scars are the result of injury. Scarring is a natural process in the healing of the skin. A wound can be made as the result of accident.<n><n>### If a book has pages, its pages are cut and the book can be read after it? Choices:  answer A: yes B: no C: book D: pages<n><n>### Response the answer is yes because you need to cut a book so you can read it.<n><n>###  How do you decide if a room has 10 or 13 walls? Choices: A: count them B: see if they have a number C: ask others D: compare the walls with each other<n><n>### Response C: The best thing to do is compare walls to ensure the number is correct<n><n>###  What does a surgeon do before cutting flesh or tissue on your body? Choices: A answer: ask for your consent B answer: heal C answer: bleed D answer: cut<n><n>### The answer is C<n><n>### What is the answer to an addition sentence (1 + 1)? Choices:  A answer: 2. B answer: 1<n><n>### The correct answer is A because when you add 1 and 1 you get the result of 2.<n><n>### The person's job of adding to the inventory is a(an) _______. Choices:  A. what B. how C. why D. where<n><n>### Answer: Answer should be B. That indicates that addition is a procedure for counting what the item is and calculating the quantity.<n><n>### What do you call a type of tree that is used for cutting? Choices:  An answer: the cutting tree B answer: the cutting tool C answer: the cutting person D

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:James needed a garage because he spent a lot of money on what? Choices:  A: bike B: downtown C: building D: tool storage E: car<n><n>### Response:		A: garage<n><n>### Comment:<n>- **Garage** comes from an *old* word that meant something like a farm building. We don’t use that word today as much to describe what we think of as “a garage.”<n><n>### Comment Ext:<n>- A garage is no longer just a place to park your car. It could also be described as:<n>  - -<n>    * a: “the building that houses a car”<n>    * b: “the building that stores car parts”<n>    * c: “the workspace for car repair”<n>  <n>### Ext:<n>- A toolbox would be a more descriptive answer.<n><n>### Exercise answers:<n>- **A:** A workspace for doing construction work.<n><n>- **B:** A business for hiring workers.<n><n>- **D:** An area to keep tools, such as a toolbox.<n>  <n>- **E:** A storage area inside a building.<n><n>- **F:** A room where people live.<n><n>### Summary:<n>*Write a list of words to describe James's *garage.*<n><n>- -<n><n>### Hint:<n>A garage could have lots of different elements!<n><n>*Make use of adjectives, nouns, and verbs, and avoid using adverbs.<n><n># What are the most common uses of the word garage?<n>*Write another list (at least five items but no more than a handful) of ways to use the word garage.*<n><n>### Closing:<n>*Review your list for grammatical consistency.*

Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:A wife asks a husband to stop being married to her, what is he likely to feel even with friends? Choices:  A: happiness B: pleasure C: happy D: grief E: isolation<n><n>### Response:		<n>We want more, we know that your skills are superb and we're hoping to get you on our team for a long term partnership and we are confident that you are going to hit all the goals and you gonna be happy.<n><n><n>### Instacart Order<n>#### Task:<n>Demonstrating, using a photo of what appears to be an existing Instacart order, to show a completed order and highlight all the required product items in a cart, along with their corresponding product details, in the form of a PDF or JPEG file. <n>#### Demonstration: Show: <n>Demonstrate a completed instacart order including pictures of all products. <n><n>#### Result: <n>Send PDF or JPEG of completed instacart order. <n><n>#### Instructions:<n><n>If you need to include a photo of a completed order, be sure to include enough detail so that all products are readily identifiable. <n>Do not try to recreate an order from scratch (as would be done in a live demo), instead, use a photo of a previously completed order. <n>There is no penalty for incompleteness if your model does not include the same quantities of product items and you can easily make substitutions by finding other items on Instacart with similar quantity measurements and prices. <n>The items you are using in your model, as long as the are similar and have the same quantity measurements, is up to you to choose, but it must be the same as what is found in your photo. <n>You do not need to include items that are not in the photo of your order, but if you do, the items you choose may not be available for your demands. <n>If you encounter any issues, please be sure to contact the appropriate people from our company through the proper channels. <n>And thank you in advance. <n><n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:The king was to meet an ambassador, where would the meet? Choices:  A: court B: dinning room C: throne room D: monarchy E: castle<n><n>### Response:		Your response will contain text.<n><n>### Answer: A: court  <n><n>### Submit<n><n>#### Submission<n>The submission format does not need to be filled.

Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:Where does a person need to get when they have more kids? Choices:  A: compliments B: understand themselves C: life partner D: second chances E: larger house<n><n>### Response:		(Please only provide an answer if the question asked it.)<n><n>Input: Where does a person go when they receive more kids? Choice answer: E: larger house <n><n>Input: What happens when we need to take a vehicle out to the park? Choices: A: get dirty B: we get wet C: our car must also move D: we go for a drive E: ride a plane<n>Answer: C: our car must go to the park<n><n>Input: Who should take the time to read the magazine if they have the need to read it? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:Riding bike through rough terrain can be dangerous, one could find themselves what? Choices:  A: pleasure B: accident C: get somewhere D: hurt E: falling down<n><n>### Response:		What is that?<n><n>### Input :A friend of yours could be described by what word for their clothing? Choices: <n><n>### Response :They could be described by what<n><n>### Instructions:<n>1. Find the subject of each sentence and the type of sentence.<n>2. Underline the subject and write the verb of the sentence.<n>3. Underline the direct object and write the verb it is of.<n>4. Auxiliaries, subjects and objects might be combined. Write both the subject and the verb.<n><n>### Example<n><n>1A. John is studying.  S<n>2A. He is playing (V, S)<n>3A. John is learning (do)<n>4B. He is enjoying it (V, A)<n><n>### Example Answer<n>

The response should consist of one or two sentences and should be at least eight words long.<n><n>### Sample Write-Up:<n>![alt text](https://github.com/codingchef/CodingChief/blob/5cf402881573a8583d24d810e423392c7c5a7000/CodingChief-images/149552-1.png "Sample Write-Up")<n><n>### Links for further study:<n><n>* Write the response on Write the response on the [whiteboard](https://codingchef.com/).<n>* [Coursera](https://www.coursera.org/learn) [Udacity](https://www.udacity.com/) [MIT](https://ocw.mit.edu/) [Codeacademy](https://codeacademy.com) and [code-academy](https//code-academy.com/)<n>

Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:What can happen to you when eating hamburger from someone that you do not know that does not happen when you usually eat a hamburger? Choices:  A: allergic reaction B: gain weight C: have fun D: heartburn E: food poisoning<n><n>### Response:		<n>I was wondering if you like hamburgers when you went to an unknown and what you usually eat a hurgar, but do you want to do this? I can not say that I like this. I always have fun when I eat with unknown hamburger because they usually have fun there. But when I get sick I usually get bored.  You can do whatever it is like if it happens to me.<n><n>### Input1:A house in the forest of a man from the ground on a tree to get up to. It is a matter of having to climb to a tree 500 meters and is located at the top floor near a man's body who is at a height of 70 meters. How should you get on your feet? (You should climb up using this.)<n><n>### Response1:<n><n>You need to go down there and then go to the ground so that you can climb up the tree.  If you go down there, you climb up the tree, you will be able to enter the forest through the door.<n><n>### Answer2:A tree 500 m from the ground and an elevated height of 70 m from the man's body is climbed by the above instructions. If you get out again to return to the ground, the tree is 500 m above the ground and the floor is less than 70 m. What do you do then?<n><n>Answer2:<n>You should not change where you are so that you do not have to climb up the tree again. <n><n>### Input3:You went downstairs with a man to meet the doctor. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:In the movie a fragile man is causing accidents, his hope is to find a person opposite of him who is what? Choices:  A: undestroyable B: unbreakable C: indestructible D: durable E: invisible<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### C:<n><n>### Input<n>### A:<n>Hey John, how your day going? I see that there are a lot of cars parked on the rail system, why is that?<n>### R:<n>I've asked that question before and I gotten an answer when I've stopped at a market. I hope this will help you.<n>### Response<n><n>### Input : Your boyfriend has got the wrong idea about you. It is probably what kind of idea? Choices: <n>A: mistaken<n>B: fantasy<n>C: imagining<n>D: concept<n>E: incorrect<n><n>### R: <n>It seems a lot of people have this feeling about me. I hope you are not one of them.<n><n>### Response<n>Your thinking about me is very accurate but not positive, I don't appreciate that.<n><n>### Input <n>How are you, my love?<n>### R :<n>I'm getting a bit bored, I want to go for a walk around the lake, would you like to come with me?<n><n>### Response <n>Of course I will.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:It was a vast complex, the launch pad was just one part of what? Choices:  A: movie B: cape kennedy C: space center D: military installation E: spaceship centre<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```swift<n>struct TailorShopApp {<n>    let title = "Tailor Shop App"<n>    private var answers = ["Fabric is cut to order by <n>            a: curtains,<n>            b: tailor shop,<n>            c: clothing store,<n>            d: sewing room,<n>            e: hardware store<n>            ],<n>            places = ["A: vegetables,<n>            B: market,<n>            C: doctors office,<n>            D: train station,<n>            E: bookstore"]<n><n>    struct Question<n>    {<n>        let title = "Directions Question"<n>        let question : String<n>        let answers : String <n>    }<n><n>    typealias Response = (bool, [String])<n>    typealias Answer = String<n><n>    private func convertToBool(_ value : String) -> Bool {<n>        switch value.lowercased() {<n>            case "a": return true<n>            case "b": return true<n>            default: return false<n>        }<n>    }<n>    init() {<n>        self.question = Question(title: self.title, question: "?")<n>        self.result = Response(true, ["A: vegetables"])<n>        self.inputArray = ["A: vegetable", "B: bookstore", "C: train station", "D: space center", "E: hardware store"]<n>        self.correct = true<n>    }<n>    var question : Question! {get set}<n>    var result : Response! {get set} <n>    var inputArray : [String] = []<n>    var correct : Bool! {get set} = true<n>    <n>    func getAnswer() -> String {<n>        return answer[correct![inputArray]]<n>    }<n>    static func checkCorrectness(_ question : Question, answer:[String]) -> Bool {<n>        for index in answer {<n>            if!question.title.caseInsensitivecompare(index)!.lowecased() {<n>                return false<n>            }<n>        }<n>        return true<n>    }<n><n>}<n>```<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:He wore the wrong shoes while walking all day, now he has what on his heels and toes? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:If you're betting with a shark, where are you likely playing? Choices:  A: aquarium B: mediterranean sea C: south pacific D: pool hall E: pacific ocean<n><n>### Response:		A: aquarium<n><n>### Input.<n><n>**Eliminate choice A.**. This is the only place that uses the word aquarium. "You are likely to be betting at an aquarium with a shark." **Eliminate choice B.**. This place is a pool hall. It doesn't use the word betting. **Eliminate choice D.**. A shark is found in the Pacific Ocean. **Eliminate choices B, C and D.**. This doesn't make sense. Choice A is the only answer.<n><n>

Choices:  A: attic B: trash C: loft D: closet E: box<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n>- The first choice "A" does not make sense with the question.<n>    It should be "B" loft, not "A" attic.<n>```<n>---<n>In a question, there are 8 choices and you only need to enter "B" in the blank space.<n><n><n>---<n><n>### Demostration<n>Input: He was looking for the holidays decorations _________ and found an old box __________ clothes up where?<n><n>Answer:<n>```<n>B: attic, C: where<n>```<n>---<n><n>## Repository:<n><n>For this lab, the following repository is the repository that I used to complete this assignment. <n><n>[Lab_8_Repository](https://github.com/fazalex/Lab_8_Repository)<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:What is another term for instituting civil action? Choices:  A: confusion B: complications C: riot D: arrest E: protests<n><n>### Response:		<n>```shell<n>#!/bin/bash<n><n>printf "input\toutput\n"<n>printf "Fabric is cut to order when\t"<n>printf "where\n"<n>printf "\n"<n><n>echo "c.clothing store"<n>echo "d.train staion"<n>echo "d:protests"<n><n>```<n><n>

Choices: 1: She feels the house<n> <n> 2: She is at school<n> <n> 3: A key and a pen<n> <n> Answer: 3: A key <br><n><n>## What is a loop?<n><n>As with any computer program, the programmer must specify how often and what type of instructions should be executed. The program specification must indicate how often the program should be run and must also indicate what type of control flow is desired. The loop specifies how often and when the program should be run. A loop is a control construct that performs a sequence of instructions or statements repeatedly until a certain condition is reached or until there is no need for the sequence<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:One way to relieve your hunger if you live near the coast is to do what? Choices:  A: grill B: go to market C: bring home fish D: eat hamburger E: make bread<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n>// Example Code<n>if (Choice.equals("A")) {<n>    return "Grill";<n>} else if(Choice.equals("B")) {<n>    return  "Goto Market";<n>} else if (Choice.equals("C")) {<n>    return"Return fish";<n>} else if  (Choice.equals("D")) {<n>    return   "Eat hamburger";<n>} else if   (Choice.equals("E")) {<n>    return       "Make bread";<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Input<n>If you want to move something heavy, you need what type of energy? Choices: 1: A: electricity 2: B: gas 3: C: wind 4: D: manual<n><n>### Response<n>```bash<n>if (Choice.Equals("1") ||  Choice.Equals("A")) {<n>     return "";<n>} else if (Choice.Equals("2") || (Choice.Equals("B"))) {<n>     return ""; <n>} else if (3){<n>   return "";<n>} else {<n>    return "Manual";<n>}<n>```

Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:What business has a tower to transmit signals? Choices:  A: city B: toronto C: radio station D: roger that E: medieval castle<n><n>### Response:		<n>```python<n>import json<n><n>import requests<n><n>r = requests.get("https://app.curql.net/graphql")<n><n>json_obj = r.json()<n><n>question_number = int(json_obj["data"]["userQuestionNumber"].value)<n><n>response = "D: train station"<n><n>graphql_response = {<n>	"type": "USER_INPUT",<n>	"userQuestionNumber": question_number,<n>	"text": response<n>}<n><n>json_data = [graphql_response]<n><n>payload = json.dumps(json_data)<n><n>response = requests.post(f"https://app.curQL.net/graphql",<n>    json = payload, headers={<n>         "Content-Type": "application/json"<n>    })<n><n>content = response.text<n><n>if 'error' in content:<n>	print("There was an error")<n>else:<n>	print(content)<n>```<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:When we are thankful for getting something what do we do? Choices:  A: say thank B: smile C: looking for D: get more E: show appreciation<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>**Input**: When we are thankful for __getting__ something, what do we do?<n><n>**Response**: <n><n>C, get more<n><n>HINT:<n><n>This question had answer choices are A, B, C, D, E.<n><n>We use the word "getting." "We do not want to be thankful for something we are receiving or acquiring." The more choices we have the easier it is to determine the question is either about receiving or giving. The word "getting" lets us know this is about receiving something.<n><n>As usual with this style of question ask yourself, "What does this question not imply?"<n><n>**Question:** What does the question not imply?<n><n>**Answer:** It does not imply that we are giving thanks. We are thankful for something. It does not assume we are thankful for things. We are thankful.<n><n>**Hint**: **There is no word or phrase in the question that implies we are giving thanks**. <n><n>We are just thankful for something that has been received.<n><n>**Key to Solving**:<n><n>As mentioned above, we are not giving anything. The question says "when we are thankful for what". When does that happen? When we are thankful.<n>As for the question does not ask for what we are thankful for. It asks the _question_ what we do when we are thankful. We answer with what we do.<n><n>### Output:<n>This is output that contains a request of the same kind and with different context to the original.<n><n>### Reference:<n><n>> Expected Output:<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>>Instructions:<n><n>Input: A company uses one of two methods which method does it use?<n><n>Choice A: The firm determines fair value based on an earnings multiple or dividend yield.<n><n>Choice B: The firm determines the fair value based on cash flows.<n><n>>Demonstration:<n><n><n>>Answer:<n><n>Choice B: <n><n>The process of determining the fair value of the company is one of the most important factors when choosing the right company to invest in. There are two different ways to determine the value of a company, one is the equity value, which is the company’s value that is calculated by dividing the company’s total assets by

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:What could fighting inflation cause if it is not successful? Choices:  A: problems B: not noticeable C: deflation D: economic instability E: eat cake<n><n>### Response:		<n>I agree with the instruction that:<n><n>### I can work with words I know and with help from the dictionary on words I don't know.<n><n>### I know the differences between the following: synonyms, homonyms, word families and antonyms.<n><n>### Input<n>  - "What could fighting inflation possibly cause if it were not successful?"<n><n>### Response<n>> In response to the instruction above, inflation is an increase in the prices of goods and services.  This would cause unemployment, a decrease in disposable income, a decrease in demand, a decrease in output, and a decrease in the growth rate of the economy.<n><n>### How<n><n>  - I can work with words with which I am familiar, and with help from the Dictionary regarding words I am unfamiliar with.<n>  - I know the differences between:<n>    - Synonyms<n>    - Homonyms<n>    - Word families<n>    - Antonyms<n>  - <n><n>### What<n><n>  - fighting inflation is an increase of the prices of goods and service.<n><n>### If<n><n>  - The price of goods and services has gone up.<n>    - Unemployment has gone up<n><n>### Why<n><n>  - If unemployment has gone up.<n><n>### The effect of a fall in real GDP means that the unemployment rate has gone up.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:Where can you learn about operations with numbers? Choices:  A: math book B: phonebook C: statistic D: music school E: office<n><n>### Response:		The person could go to any place that is selling something. This could be a tailor store that sells fabric, or a clothing store that sells fabric cut to order. The person is in a tailor shop waiting for fabric to be cut to order. The tailor is at a clothing store, cutting fabric to order.<n>### Output: The person will be waiting for a vehicle at a train station. The person is most likely traveling someplace else and is awaiting a vehicle and a ride. The vegetables in the market will not be useful to him if he needs a ride. He could do what he is doing in the bookstore, waiting for something, only instead of waiting for a ride he waits for a train, waiting for a train to run him to where he needs to go. He could do what his doing here and go to the doctor while he is waiting for a ride or train. The doctor could give him some medication to make him stop thinking about rides.<n><n>### Input:"Where are you if you are waiting for a letter from your cousin? Choices: A: post office B: library C: home D: work<n><n>### Response:"I would be at home writing my cousin a letter and waiting for a reply. I would also be waiting for her to send me something in the mail. She could send me music, letters, her phone, her watch, her junk mail, and many other things. I could go home and write a letter to someone and wait for a response. Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:What could someone be doing while performing that cannot be enjoyed by deaf people? Choices:  A: smile B: singing C: sweat D: act E: dance<n><n>### Response:		<n>`If a person is singing the vocal range (which includes the tone of their voice) cannot be interpreted via lip reading. While a deaf person can use hearing aids or hearing dogs to identify the sounds and interpret them (in addition to their knowledge of how they are pronounced), singing is usually performed when the mouth is shut.`

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:Sam left his muddy shoes in the entryway.  Where might he be? Choices:  A: department store B: school C: garden D: office building E: house<n><n>### Response:		A: department store<n><n>### Input<n><n>```<n>    [3] - Hello, customer!<n>    [3] : Please enter your ID:<n>```<n>### Response:<n><n>* Please enter your ID number, the person speaking will repeat your number for verification<n>* Please enter your password, the person speaking will read your password for verification<n><n>* To place an order<n>```<n>[3] (confirm what)<n>[1] - Beef Chuck<n>```<n>* To cancel an order<n>```<n> [2]- I would like to cancel my order<n>```<n>* To check order status:<n>```<n> [4] - Check status of order:<n>[4] : Order #<n>```<n>* To view item information<n>```<n> [3] : Item ID<n>```<n> * Question:<n>```<n> [2]: Hi Bob, how are you?<n> [1]: I'm just fine<n>```<n><n>### Answer:<n>- Please place your order!<n>- Cancel your order if you don't need it anymore!<n>- Check the status of your order!<n>- Look up the item you want!<n>- How are you?<n><n>### Input :<n><n>```<n>  [3] - Welcome, customer!<n>  [3]: Are you shopping or eating at this time?<n>  [1]: Shopping<n>```<n><n>## Response:<n>- No thanks, I'm not hungry.<n>- Yes but I still have some time and would like to shop here.<n>- Yes, I'm just picking up some food.<n>

Choices:  A: chess set B: strategy C: toy store D: chess game E: small case<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choices A: chess set and B: strategy<n><n>### Instructions:<n>**Instructions 2**<n><n>I'm going to be an old fashion tailor soon<n><n>### 1. Demonstration: Input:  What do you know about Fabric? Choices: A: Fabric can be found at fabric stores B: Fabric is lightweight C: Fabric is heavy fabric D: Fabric is made of cotton E: Fabrics is not the same as cotton F: Fabric is a soft material G: Fabric is available only in one color per fabric<n><n>Another way to ask this question, What color is Fabric made of?<n><n>### 2. Response <n>Choices A: Fabric can  be found at fabric stores, B: Fabric is heavy, C: Fabric is light, D: Fabric is available in many different colors, E: Fabrics is soft, F: Fabric is available to all people, G: Fabrics is made up many different types of material <n><n>### 3. D. The train station. E. The bookstore.<n><n>### 4. Demonstration<n>If I wanted to store by chess pawns when I'm not using it, what would I do with it? Choices:<n>A. put it back in the chess set. B. it would be best in a small case. C. buy a chess game. D. buy a strategy book. Choices:  A. one story B. two story C. apartment D. multi-story house E. cottage<n><n>```markdown <n>#A. one story<n>```<n><n>## What did it take to set up the project? Please state the process. Be specific.<n>For this project you will need to install MSBuild on your machine. Run the 'MSBuild project.sln' file, which is a C# application that can help you generate the questions used to train the neural network. <n>When it's being built you will have to give various inputs. The first two are: the file-path of the file that specifies the type of the inputs and outputs for the neural network, and the file-path of a folder that contains test images. For instance, if you want to train the model on 128x128 images you will have to provide the input file 'train_settings.txt' which has the following settings: <n><n>```markdown    <n>test size: 128x<n><n>input type: image<n><n>input size: 127x128<n><n>test size: 224x<n><n>output type: list<n><n>output label size: 4<n><n>output size: 123<n>```<n><n>The second input file is 'testimage_files.txt'. This also contains 1500 images, which should be the test set images that the neural network will be training on. For example:<n><n>```markdn   <n>image1: img_47091.png<n>image2: img_48904.png<n><n>...<n>```<n><n>

Choices:  Choices: <n>"A: fishing B: walking C: cooking D: hunting E: hiking"<n><n>- What color is he most likely to be? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: short term B: crowd C: unpredictable D: frequent E: eternal<n><n>### Response:		<n>Crowd  <n>Crowd: gather in a hurry with no order; a tumultuous confusion; mass, throng; a press of people  _MERRIAM-WEBSTER ONLINE (www.merriam-webster.com)_<n><n>### Demand:Describe how to find the best prices on electronics.<n><n>### Response<n>First, search for the item you want to buy on google. Second, search for the price of that item on www.pricegrabber.com, for the best prices.<n><n>### Assignment:<n>You are to write an instruction that requires your team to write five different responses. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:What will happen to your knowledge with more learning? Choices:  A: headaches B: bigger brain C: education D: growth E: knowing more<n><n>### Response:		<n>| Input                       |  |  |  |             |  |  |<n>| ----------------------------|---|---|---        |---|---|<n>|   A: vegetables             |  | 5 |  |  |       |<n>|   B: market               |  | 4 |  |  |        |<n>|   C: doctor                |  | 4  |  | 2      |<n>|   D: train station          |  | 5  |  | 3      |<n>|   E: bookstore              |  | 5   |  | 7      |<n>### Solution:<n><n>| Input                       Answer             |  |<n>|:-----------------------------:----------------|----|<n>|   A. vegetables                   B                |<n>|   B. market                      A                |   <n>|   C. doctor                      E                |<n>|   D. train station                D                |<n>|   E. bookstore                    A                |<n>### Explaination:<n>For example B -> A: vegetables - B. market - C. doctor - D., train station - E. bookstore - A. <n><n>### Output:<n>B.  <n>C.<n>E.<n>A.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:What will all the differences equal? Choices:  A: sum B: likeness C: alike D: sameness E: similarity<n><n>### Response:		Response that appropriately completes what is asked.<n><n>```python<n>question=''<n>Answer ='yes'<n>while question!= 'A':<n><n>question = input('Question: ')<n><n>if question == 'Fabric is cut to order by whom? ':<n>             if Answer == 'A':'B':<n>Answer ='A'<n>elif Answer == 'C':'D':<n>Answer='B'<n>if question == 'Why are you reading magazines while at the station? ':<n>             print(Question+' I am waiting for the train')<n>if Answer == 'yes':<n>Answer = 'true'<n>if question =='Is there any similarity between them?':<n>if Answer == 'E':'A':<n>Answer= 'B'<n>if question = 'Would you say the same about the two types of questions?':<n>if Answer=='C':'B':<n>answer ='D'<n>print(answer)<n>```<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:What does exercising immediately lead to? Choices:  A: relaxation B: exhaustion C: energetic D: become stronger E: use energy<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>- Exercise after you make yourself exhausted<n>- You need to make a plan on what to do<n><n>### Solution:<n>- 答案为D: become stronger (strengthen)。<n>- 使用动词“exercise”后，动词改为第三人称即可。<n><n>#### Task 2<n><n>### Instructions:Complete the following sentence.<n><n>#### Demonstration: <n>To prepare for a long journey, you need to __________. (A) think about how hard the trip will be. (B) find a map of the area. (C) check that luggage is available. (D) decide on the number of suitcases you can carry. (E) book accommodation when reaching your destination.<n><n>#### Input:Which of the above is a must before making a trip?<n><n>#### Response:<n><n>- C and E must be done<n><n>#### Solution: <n>- 输入中所有的动词中，除第一个动词外全部都是第一人称，所以这里应当转换为第三人称。<n><n><n>### Instuctions:Complete the following statement.<n><n>#### Demostration:<n>When you are at the checkout of a store, you can do (A) pay cash or get a credit card. (B) ask the cashier to apply for a card. (C) get a card as a gift. (D) pay with an account card. (E) request a cashier’s help.<n><n>#### Response:I need a credit card to do (pay by credit card)<n><n>#### Solution:<n>- A is (to), B is (to ask), C is (a gift), D is (by credit card), E is (for help)。<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:We want to try some new barbecue sauces, where should we buy some? Choices:  A: detroit B: australia C: michigan park D: cafe E: retail store<n><n>### Response:		You should buy some barbeque sauce at a grocery.<n><n>### Expected Output:This response is correct. <n><n>| Question |   Answer |<n>| ----------- | -----    |<n>| Question 1 | Fabic  |<n>| Question 2 | Station  |<n>| Question3 | Grocery  |<n><n>### Implementation:<n>```python<n><n>'''<n>This file was created by student ID 9800.<n><n>'''<n><n>class Solution:<n>    # @param seller: a string<n>    # @return: a string<n>    def findTheBestPrice(self, seller):<n>        # Initialize and output variable<n><n>        # Loop through the string and add it to a dictionary <n>        # which holds the seller and cost<n>        dictionary = {}<n>        answer = 0<n>        for key in seller:<n><n>            dictionary[dictionary.get(key,[0])] += 1<n><n>        # Finds the dictionary with the highest key<n>        for key in dictionary:<n>            <n>            if dictionary[key] > answer:<n>                answer = dictionary[key]<n><n>        answer +=1<n>        return answer<n><n><n>if __name__ == '__main__':<n><n>    # Testing<n>    seller = "Fabric is cut to order here"<n>    test = Solution()<n>    output = test.findTheBestPrice(seller).upper()<n><n>    print(output)
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:What body of water is typically shallow water? Choices:  A: lake B: aquariums C: swimming pool D: pond E: childrens pools<n><n>### Response:		A: Choices were : lake, aquariums, swimming pool, pond and children's pools.<n>Answers:A, D<n><n>### Question:<n>I have several pieces of clothing laying everywhere in my home. A large section of it is in my spare room. Some items, such as scarves, I never wear, so I want the rest of my clothing to go. My husband and I need to find a charitable thrift organization. Which charitable organization can I donate my clothing to?<n><n>### Answer:<n>I can donate my clothing in one of two ways:<n>1.  Donate clothing to my favorite charity, which is Salvation Army. They provide many services and programs for the surrounding community. They accept all types of clothing, but I encourage you to check the website for other items, they might accept.<n>2.  I can donate clothing to Goodwill, which is also accepting other articles.<n><n>### Response<n>Your request is answered appropriately.<n><n>### Comment 1<n>This is fine response.<n><n>### Answer 2<n>This response is acceptable.<n><n>### Other Answers<n>This response should contain a citation and a reference to the question or the source.<n><n>### Source<n>1.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n4x8v33vO20&t=554s<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:The explorers found a central passage, much to their delight it led straight to the ancient buried what? Choices:  A: public building B: tomb C: arena D: large building E: treasure<n><n>### Response:		The explorers found a temple much to their delight.<n><n>### Input Choices (A-E)<n>| Choice | Answer<n>----|----|<n>A | Beverages<n>B | Spice Mix<n>C | Garments<n>D | Fruit and Vegetae<n>E | Jewellery<n><n>### Instructions<n>Write a function that returns the letter that is found before the last in a text.<n><n>Input -<n>String: "Wondering to" Answer - "n"<n>String: "Still thinking of" Answer - "l"<n>String: "Not yet found" Answer - "f"<n><n><n>### Input/Output Example – <n>| String | Letter<n>----|----<n>"Wondering to" | "n"<n>"Still thinking of" | "l"<n>"Not yet found" | "f"<n><n>### Solution -<n>```cpp<n>#include <iostream><n>#include <sstream><n><n>using namespace std;<n> <n>string findLetter(string& str)<n>{<n>    int l = 0, found = -1;<n>    string s;<n> <n>    for (int i = 0; i < str.length(); i++) {<n>        if (str[i] == found) {<n>            break;<n>        } else if (str[i - 1] == found) { //found at the start of the word<n>            s = str.substr(0, i);<n>            found = -1; // stop the search, found letter was at the start of the string<n>            return s;<n>        } else {<n>            l = i; //found letter at some point in the string<n>            found = str[i];<n>        }<n>    }<n>    //for loop ends<n> <n>    // found at the start of the sentence<n>    if (l == 0) {<n>        return s;<n>    }<n> <n>    if ((l - 1) == -1 || str[l - 1]!= found) {<n>        // not found anymore, return what's left of the string<n>        s = str.substr(((l + 1) == - 1)? 0 : (l + 1));<n>        return s; <n>    }<n>  // not found anymore from the start so go backwards and

Where else can the manager say you need to wear a cloth mask <n><n>## Demonstration: <n><n>Choose where else can the manager say. The word "arctic" should not be in this set of options as arctic describes a region and is therefore not correct. The word "white house" is not a synonym to warm weather; moreover, it is a wrongly capitalized reference to an incorrect spelling of the phrase 'White house."<n><n>Input:What is the best seller of a pet shop? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:Before getting a divorce, what did the wife feel who was doing all the work? Choices:  A: harder B: anguish C: bitterness D: tears E: sadness<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### Response A<n><n>To cut fabric to measurement, it is necessary that the fabric is cut to order. That is, the tailoring store cuts fabric to measure. Fabric is cut to measurement by sewing.<n><n>#### Response B<n><n>The wife felt about tears in all the work she did before getting a divorce.<n><n>#### Response C<n><n>The word "anguish" is a feeling of severe mental or physical pain experienced when in a difficult or painful situation. She felt "anguish" after getting divorced when she had to work harder. This is because she is very busy during the separation of the workplace.<n><n>#### Response D<n><n>The wife felt bitter in her work after divorce. She felt bitter because she was no longer able to do the same work with her husband.<n><n>#### Response E<n><n>The wife felt sorrow in her work after the divorce. She felt the pain of losing the best times shared in her marriage.<n><n>### Your response will be graded using a two point rubric. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:Sky diving scared him, once they jumped out of the plane he began losing consciousness while what? Choices:  A: injury B: death C: playing uno D: coma E: falling down<n><n>### Response:		E for falling down then when he hit the ground he passed out.<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Demostration or  show where you are if he is a scammer.<n>A- B- C- D-<n>- E-<n><n>### Answer: A- B- C- or D- <n>- or  E-<n><n>----<n><n>### Below is an instruction that describe a task. Write a respons that appropriately completes<n>the request.<n><n>Instruction: Write the following code into your new JavaScript program. It will check if the word is a word (a vowel sound) or not.<n><n>Input: A word is a vowel if it has a vowel sound; otherwise it is not.<n><n>Demonstration: Enter the phrase “This is a test”. It will check if the vowel sound is correct.<n><n>Answer: <n>**// Write your code here! ///**<n><n>```javascript<n>function isVowel (c) {<n>  const isAlpha = isValidAlphabet(c, "abcdefghijklmnpqrstuvwxyz");<n>  const isNotDashOrSpaceChar = isValidAlphabetNotDashOrSpace(c, "__- ");<n>  if (isAlpha && isNotDashOr SpaceChar)<n>  return true;<n>  return isAlpha? false : true;<n>}<n><n>function isValidAlphabetNotSpecial (c, valid, nonValid) {<n>  return valid.indexOf(c)!== -1 || nonValid.indexOf(c) === -1;<n>}<n><n><n><n>```<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:What has a master of their craft done about that craft? Choices:  A: drill B: committed murder most vile C: bargemaster D: learn E: understand<n><n>### Response:		A master of their craft has drilled down into that craft to improve as he grows in that craft.<n>#### Demonstration: Choices are: <n><n>* A: drill - drill, drilling - drilling<n>* B: committed murder most foul - committed murder most vile<n>* C: barge master - bargemaster<n>* D: learn - learn/learn to/learn how to (to do something)/to learning<n>* E: understand - understand/understanding/understand how to (to do) something<n><n>#### Demonstrated on<n>* A: drilling<n>* B, C, D, E: to learning<n><n>### Input(3) : In what place does an object (an item of clothing) go to if you are trying to wear that item before you buy it?<n>Answer: C: fitting room<n><n>### Input (5): What is a woman who is of royal blood?<n>Response: She is a regent if she is a queen. If she is a noblewoman, than she is a Duchess.<n><n>#### Demonstated on<n>* Female: Que(na)<n>* Female : Noble: Duchess<n>* Male: Noble: Duke<n><n>

When the fighting started, he only saw what sort of things? Choices:  A: fort B: orphans C: battlefield D: other countries E: war<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choices:  A: "Fort"<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions. In each case, choose the question or questions that you believe will produce a positive<n>response from the user. You can select more than one question.<n><n>## Solution:<n><n>### Instructin:Where are you when your reading magazines and waiting for a vehicle to pass by?Choices: A: vegetables B.  market<n>C: doctor D:train stop<n><n>Choice is A:'vegetables'<n><n>### Instrumentation:<n>You are on your way to purchase the groceries for the day. Which of the following would be the most likely method of transportation?<n><n>Choice: A: 'cars'<n><n>### Response<n>You are waiting for a subway train to arrive at the station. Which of the following does not apply to this action?<n><n>Choice A: 'Waiting at the hospital'<n><n>### Solution:<n>There are many more instructions that need to be implemented. See below:<n>### First Instruction:<n>You are having lunch at a public park, reading a magazine. With which of the following activities are you participating?<n><n>Choice: B<n><n>### Second Instructions:<n>You are in a car, driving to the airport. After arriving at the airport, what are you doing?<n><n>Choices: B: 'Airport terminal'<n><n>### Final Instructions:<n>John joined the army because h wanted to see the world and started traveling the world. When the fighting started when he only saw what?<n><n>Choices A: 'Fort'<n><n>### Conclusion:<n>You must complete the instructions before sending the user to the next phase. You can do this by either answering a question, or giving the user the information they need to understand what to do next. You must also be careful not to put more instructions than necessary onto a screen. If you do, the user will lose interest and not complete the task.<n>

Write a response that correctly fixes the bugs in code blocks 1, 2, and 4, as well as replaces all instances of the string “error” with the English word “mistake”.<n><n>### Script:<n>`error = "You cannot enter any string."`<n>`a = 10`<n>`a = "apple" if a >= 30`<n>`a= "error" if a >= 10`<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Correct code block 1: Replace the string “error” on line 15 with the word “mistake.”<n><n>Correct code blocks 2 & 4: Replace all instances of “error” in script one with the English word “error.”<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>### 1.<n>**Correct Code Block 1: Replace the String 'error' on Line 15 with the Word 'Mistake'.**<n><n>    error = "Someone can enter apple only."<n><n>### 2.<n>**Correct code blocks 1: Replace the 'error' to the English word 'error'.*<n><n>    error = error = "error"<n><n><n>### 3.<n>**Correct Block 2: Replace All Instances of 'error' to the word mistake in Script 1.**<n><n>    error= "mistake"<n><n>### Response to Script<n><n>1. Correct Code Block 1<n><n>The code contains an error in line 15. Above, "mistake" is the correct word.<n><n>2. Correct Code Blocks<n><n>The code has several "error" variables that must be changed to the word: "error."<n><n>3. Correct Block 2<n><n>Instead of "error", a word is changed to "mistake".<n><n>## Below is an example of a task with one or more incorrect statements. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:The turkey needed to be kept from spoiling, what is useful in this situation? Choices:  A: refrigerator B: fridge C: freezer D: oven E: bought at store<n><n>### Response:		<n>For an answer, first determine what the instruction asks from how it's organized.<n>The answer is always at the end, so it helps to be aware of location. With these examples, the instruction has: <n> * a single line of text,<n> * at the end of the instruction, one question followed by one answer choice in a list,<n> * all answers are different.<n>Answers can also be listed in a paragraph but:<n> * answers are usually in a list, and<n> * any paragraph with answers has each answer on one separate line.<n><n>When the instruction ends:<n> * if exactly one answer is listed, the selected choice is simply a comma, and<n> * if exactly two answers are listed, the selected choice has both choices enclosed each other.<n><n>### Example<n><n>    ### Instruction:Answer the above multiple choice question.<n>    <n>    ### Demonstration:Inputs are at the top of the instruction<n><n>    Input 1: Fabric is cut at a type of store. Choices are a,b,c,d,e.<n>    Input 2: Where is input 1 found? Choices are a,c,b,d.<n>    ***The answer for these inputs is a,b,d. ***<n>    <n>### Answer for example<n><n>    I think these instruction sets are:<n><n>    Inputs are at the top: **True**;<n><n>    Instruction ends: **Comma**;<n><n>    Input 2 is: **A:train station**;<n><n>### Other Example<n><n>    ### Example<n>    <n>    ### Instruction 1:Find the answer to the above multiple choice question that are found using the example input.<n>    <n>    #### Input: The turkey needed to be a fruit to keep from spoiling. What is useful in this situation that is not helpful? Choices:  a: refrigerator b: fridge c: freezer d: oven e: bought at store<n>    <n>    #### Demonstration<n>    <n>    #### Answer: Freezer (e)<n>    ##<n>    ### Instruction2: Find the answer to the above question.<n>    <n>     #### Input: Where is the turkey located? Choices: 1: fridge 2: oven 3: refrigerator 4: market 5: vegetables<n>        #### Demon

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:What happens to people playing games? Choices:  A: winning B: entertainment C: happiness D: cheating E: relaxation<n><n>### Response:		<n>A: winning B: entertaining C: relaxation D: cheating E. games<n><n>---<n>### Exercises<n>####  Write a complete list of all the possible outcomes of using a particular kind of machine.<n>A) A. sewing machine B. electric machine C. hand machine<n><n>####  What does the word “machine” mean?<n><n>A) a device used to make clothes B) a device used to teach a class in a school C) a device used to entertain yourself<n><n>####  What is the difference between a manual machine and an automatic machine? Provide an example of each.<n><n>A) A manual machine needs the person operating it to keep pushing a bar or pedal with his or her foot. An example of this type of machine is a hand-cranked lawn mower. B) An automatic machine is operated by an item of clothing such as a sock that presses down on a bar or pedal. Examples of automatic machines are a clothes washing machine and a clothes drier.<n><n>####  What would be the benefit of having an automated sewing machine?<n><n>An automated sewing machine takes much less effort because it can sew without stopping if you only have to sit beside it and hold a sock down on a pedal.<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:Sam was against Allison's decision.  Joe was the opposite.  What was Joe, regarding that decision? Choices:  A: being for B: away from C: combined D: for or E: conjunction<n><n>### Response:		 D: for or<n><n>* If the subject of a sentence is a phrase, use "for" instead of "combined."<n>* If someone says that they "agree" or "disagree" or "think it's a good idea", the "it" in their opinion is part of the predicate as a sentence.<n><n>### Input (a continuation of previous):  Sam was against Allison't decision.  Joe was against Allison'ts decision.  What was Joe? Choices: A: against B: in agreeance C: towards E: for<n><n>### Response (again, this one is a continuation of earlier):<n>```<n>Sam was against Allison’t decision.  Joe did not agree with the decision.<n>```<n><n>### Input(last one): If you see Sam at the mall, you might like to visit him at his home.  What are you doing if you do this? Choices: A (none) B: visit C: home D: home visit E: see<n><n>### Response(last one):<n>```<n>If you see Sam at the Mall, you might like to go to his home.<n>```<n><n>---<n><n>### What is the subject in the next sentence?<n>(a)  The person that had asked for my help has never liked coffee. They said they do not like its taste. (b)  The person who had asked for my help, had never liked coffee. They didn’t like the taste of the drink.<n><n>I like to do this task for 2 reasons:<n>1. It improves my skills at understanding the subject matter<n>2. It helps me understand how the teacher/TA will view these exercises.  <n><n>This is a good question for both because they each answer the subject to the questions.    <n><n>### Questions: Do we have to use a comma after "the" in the phrase in (b)?<n><n>## To Do:<n><n>- [ ]  I will review my written submission.<n>- [ ]  If I made an error, I will go back and correct it.<n>- [ ] I will review other submission, as well as a submission from someone in the group that I did not work with.<n><n>### Question: Does the subject of the last sentence in the last task change at all? If so, how?<n><n>

Choices:  A: pet the dog B: hear sounds C: have sex D: reproduce E: drive cars<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Fabric is cutt to order at the tailor shop as fabric is a perishable goods. The fabric should be bought from a seller where fabric is cut to order. The fabric should be cut to an individual as tailors cut fabric according to individual orders of consumers. Thus, the fabric should be bought from the tailor shop and not, for example, from the fabric department of a big store.<n><n>When humans are exposed to noisy it is often that they have sexual intercourse. Therefore, exposure to noises might help humans to reproduce.<n><n>```<n>//Response,<n>```<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:Where could you find some large pieces of paper that are not for sale? Choices:  A: cabinet B: computer printer C: suitcase D: office supply store E: artist's studio<n><n>### Response:		<n>Give the correct letter, A or B, of the choices after the question to complete each statement. If the question does not require a choice, choose no answer for the choices.<n><n>1. Fabric is  cut to order  at a<n>2. Where are you if your  reading  magazines while waiting  for a  vehicle on rails?<n><n>There are three or more choices in a multiple choice question. Exactly one letter, A or B or no answer, must be given as the answer for each question. Extra points will be awarded for providing an answer that matches the statement as closely as possible.<n>### Output:<n>For each question, exactly one letter, A or I, must be given as an answer. You will need to do extensive research to write a response to this question.<n><n>## Instructions: What should the writer consider with regards to what the reader should know prior to you beginning?<n><n>You should note that if you don't understand an element of the writing that it should probably be addressed in a later post to demonstrate why it is not a good idea. Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:The teams were evenly matched when competing against one another, what did spectators want to find out? Choices:  A: envy B: resentment C: winning or losing D: one winner E: two winners<n><n>### Response:		<n> 1.<n>"Your guess on the fabric cutting on type of seller is incorrect, the correct answer is clothing store.<n>Clothing store fabric is cut to order. Cutting fabric to order can include cutting patterns and assembling material.<n>Clothing store employees also sew garments. If the clothing customer can not sew the item the customer buys the clothing. Clothing fabric is always custom made to fit the customer and no items are ever the same. Sewing patterns, custom fitting, and custom sewing are all part of cutting fabrics to order. Custom made clothing fits the customer and not the clothing."<n><n>1.<n>"Your correct! You have a great train of thought.<n>Trains are used as a form of transportation which is a good description of the market. If you were at the market you would be purchasing goods which are made and packaged to be sold. The market would be where you purchase fresh produce and vegetables.<n><n>Hope this helps :)"<n><n>### Input:"How did I go about determining who won?"<n><n>"Your guess on one of the teams winning is incorrect, the correct response is you will see if both teams are evenly matched.<n>One of these questions we have discussed is the comparison between team A and team B. The teams are evenly matched because both teams show signs of equal opportunity. When the teams are evenly matched the outcome of the game is unknown and it will be interesting to see who does win. Weather team A or team B wins is unknown because they do not show over bearing strength in any area of play.<n>With one of these teams it would be interesting that they would win in the area of sportsmanship and the level at which they played is consistent to their play.<n>Your guess on one team winning because of sportsmanship is incorrect, the correct guessing is which team won.<n>The reason that which team won is correct is there are different questions on competing in a sporting event. The winning is the outcome of the event.<n>The competing questions were in the past or which team won this event.<n>Hope this helps"<n>### Input:What do people do at a bookstore?<n><n>"In the instruction you will find out what people do at a book store and you should answer this question correctly. Choices are A: read B: buy books C: play games in the

Choice: K answer people in that store are going Choice

Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? The length in miles<n>C. The diameter<n>D. Kilometers<n>E. Dollars spent<n><n>When I used the above task, it works fine. (it means "How do you measure")<n><n>\strong{You need to know when you are making a question correct or not.}<n>If in the first question you answer "ok", then the second question must be "ok" too.<n><n>\begin{code}<n>class myProblem{<n><n>public static void main(String[] args) {<n><n>    Input: "How do you me<n>    tire distance between  two places<n>    Choices: kilometers and miles<n>    "<n>    {<n>        //This code isn't valid in my compilador<n>    }<n><n>    Input:"Where are you  if your<n>    reading magazines while<n>    waiting for a vehicle on<n>    rails?<n>     Choices: vegetables, market, doct<n>      or, train  station, bookstore<n>     "<n>    {<n><n>         {<n>            if((Input!="vegetable")){ if(Input!="market"){if(Input!="doctor")if(Input!="train station"){ if(Input!="bookstore"){ return "correct"; }<n><n>            } }<n>            if(Input==="vegetables")

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:She had been applying for job for weeks with no call back, she knew she was qualified, so what did she feel? Choices:  A: employment B: frustration C: stress D: working hard E: love<n><n>### Response:		<n>If you look at the first two sample responses you can notice that the correct response had the same exact amount of lines in the sample as the sample input. The second part is where I am having trouble because it is written in a few formats, but also in the same amount of lines. I was told to respond like this:<n><n><center><n><img src="..\..\datafiles\Pics2.png" alt="Pics3" style="height: 10rem; width:10rem"/><n><img src="\..\..\data files\Pics4.png" alt="Picture 5" style="height:10rem; width :10rem" /><n></center><n><center><n><n><n>### Demostration:<n>The reason the answer to the third and last question is different is because the first two questions had the exact same amount of input lines as well as the number of correct answer lines. But in the last question,the input lines are 400 and the correct amount of lines is 52, so the last line is missing 7 lines, so that is why their response will not be 52. That was why I split the number of lines up into two parts: 400 for the input (the number the person gave on the sample response) but when they said 52 (the correct answer), I added those 7 lines to the total.<n>

Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:Sammy wanted to go to where the people were.  Where might he go? Choices:  A: race track B: populated areas C: the desert D: apartment E: roadblock<n><n>### Response:		A: population; (Note: The input is a noun and should be plural.)<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Create a program that allows a user to input words and then the program produces a response that matches the user input.<n><n>### Examples:<n><n>Input: "Teach".<n>Output: "Learning is lifelong."<n><n>Input: "Romeo", "Mind", "Say". (A word must be separated by space.)<n>Output: "Romeo" + "Mind thy Say to another"<n><n>### Demographics<n>Input: 4 letters and 3 letters, no other words can be used. Example: "Romeo".<n>Output: "Shakespeare, The Bard"<n><n>### Input<n>Input: "Tailor"<n>Output: "Sew, needle, thread, stitch, fabric, cloth, clothing"<n><n>### Instructor:<n><n>### Question:<n><n>Input: Sam, Sammy, Samual<n>Answer: Samuel or Samuel Sam<n><n>### Demographic:<n>Input: Samuel Sam<n>Answer: Sam or Samuel  or Samuel Sam<n><n>Input: Samuel Sam Sam<n>Answer: Samuel Sam Sam or Sam or Samuel <n><n>### Instrumentation:<n><n>### Instances:<n><n><dl><n>  <dt>What is the solution?</dt><n>  <dd><n><n>  <dl><n>    <dt>What is another solution?</dt>    <n>    <dd><n><n>    <br><n>      <dl><n>        <dt>Is there a solution using other words?</dt> <n>        <dd>Sure<n><n><n>      <dl> <n>        <dt>How can I get an output for 2 words?</dt><n>        <dd><n><n>        <br><n>          <dl><n>            <dt>How can we handle long words?</dt>   <n>            <dd><n><n><br><n><n><n>  <dt>How do I add a 3rd word?</dt>  <n>  <dd>Add another space.<n><br><n>  <n>  <dt>I need a 4th word!</dt>   <n>  <dd>Increase the size of the input array. <n><

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:Someone lacking immortality will one day be? Choices:  A: kick the bucket B: mortal C: dead D: can die E: dying<n><n>### Response:		<n>For input questions, use the correct type of seller from multiple choice B. Next use a single sentence to accurately describe the input response. <n><n>For example with the fabric question:<n><n>"Clothes are cut at what type of sellers?"<n><n>"Fabric is cut to order in a tailor shop!"<n><n>If the input question is a person with immortality will one die?<n><n>"People with immortality will eventually die."<n><n><n>### Input & Response:<n>For input and response questions, use the correct answer from the multiple choice. Use the appropriate one sentence response based on the input to properly answer the question.<n><n>For example with inputs of "Where are you if you are reading magazines while on a railways for a vehicle?"<n><n>"I'm waiting on a train while reading."<n><n>### Other:<n>For other types of question, use the correct answer to the question and describe it with one sentence. If that's not a response that fits the purpose of what they're attempting to do, it will likely be given the same score as an incorrect response and not receive extra credit.<n><n>For example, with the 'Someone who lacks immortality will one of these days':<n><n>"Someone without immortality will eventually be dead."<n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Answer: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Answer: D: train station<n><n>### Input:Where must one wear a white shoe? Choices:  A: wedding B: tennis C: closet D: left foot E: house<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```java<n>public class Tester {<n>		public static void main(String args[]) {<n>				System.out.println(A);<n>		}<n>}<n>```<n><n><n>### Input<n><n>### Response<n><n><n>### Instructions<n><n><n><n>### Demostration<n><n>### Demo:<n><n><n><n>## <n><n>### Instruitction: Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>### Demo<n><n>## # # # # # #  # # # # #<n><n>## Instruction<n><n><n>## # #<n><n>## Demonstration<n><n>## Input:<n>```<n>public final class Tester {<n>  public static void main(String[] args) {<n>    System.out.println(new Tester().method(1, false));<n>  }<n>}<n><n>class Tester {<n>  private String answer;<n>  public Tester() {<n>    answer = getAnswer(1, true);<n>  }<n>  private static String getAnswer(int i, boolean b) {<n>  System.out.println("i: " + i + " b: "  + b);<n>  if (i+1 > 5) {<n>    return "D:";<n>  } else if (i + b) {<n>    return "^d ";<n>  } else {<n>    return "^A ";<n>  }<n>} <n>  public String method(int i, boolean a) {<n>    String c=getAnswer(i, a);<n>    System.out = c;<n>    System.out += "A: " + "B: ";<n>    System.out ++;<n>    return "!";<n>}<n>}<n>```

Choices:  A: toy store B: home C: school D: toy shop E: shelf<n><n>### Response:		The type of store from which you would purchase sewing fabric is a clothing store. This is because a tailor shop is one in which sewing of all types are done. A clothing store on the other hand only sells clothing and sewing fabric. The place I would play a board game with a family is a toy store. This is because you only find toys in toy stores. The type of toys in toy store are board games. To play a board game I have to visit a toy store.<n><n>[1]: https://github.com/felipequimpo/KAT_T4-L3p7<n>
